summary: Project is now focused on restoring/creating the missing frontend so core UI features (notably avatar uploads and image upload behavior) can function.
architectural_notes: Backend expects avatar blobs stored in UserProfile.avatar via saveCallerUserProfile (usernameAvatars map is obsolete).
Current build failures stem from missing/renamed frontend directory structure (e.g., frontend/src not found), so frontend features cannot be implemented until frontend exists.
known_issues: Users cannot upload avatars because the frontend/avatar upload implementation is missing (and possibly the entire frontend directory is absent).
Image upload/compression pipeline may be blocking uploads; GIFs should bypass compression.

existing_features.title: Ensure the frontend React application is present and builds/runs successfully using the existing entry points (frontend/index.html loading /src/main.tsx, and frontend/src/main.tsx rendering frontend/src/App.tsx). Fix any missing imports, broken routes, or placeholder/empty components that prevent the frontend from compiling.

Provide a working user avatar upload flow in the frontend User Settings page: allow selecting an image file, generate a preview, compress images client-side (while preserving animated GIFs by skipping recompression), upload the bytes to the backend by calling the existing `saveCallerUserProfile` mutation with `UserProfile.avatar` set, and refresh displayed avatar after a successful save.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create/restore the frontend app folder and basic structure so UI code can be added and built
Implement working user avatar upload flow (frontend UI + call backend saveCallerUserProfile to store UserProfile.avatar)
Adjust image compression behavior to skip compression for GIF files during uploads

projectName: Create/restore frontend app and ensure avatar upload works
